content.aboutText:
JordanCon is a fantasy literature convention founded in honor of the late author, Robert Jordan. Jordan was the author of the best-selling The Wheel of Time series. JordanCon features eight tracks of simultaneous programming, a Dealers' Hall, gaming, an Art Show featuring original art by a variety of artists, and charity events benefiting the Mayo Clinic and other charities. Past guests have included Harriet McDougal, Brandon Sanderson, Mary Robinette Kowal, Sam Weber, David Wong, Jana G. Oliver, Emilie Bush, David B. Coe, Eugie Foster, Seanan McGuire, Michael Whelan, Larry Elmore, Saladin Ahmed, Todd Lockwood, and Patrick Rothfuss.

We are a 501(c)4 tax-exempt organization.
content.appText:
Con-Nexus is a lightweight, open-source convention app framework created by Ben Gundersen, and built with React Native. You can find more information on my GitHub, or email me: ben@bengundersen.com.

Made with ♥ in New York City

events.title: Sanderson Trivia: Team Edition
events.description: Trivia from the Cosmere and other Brandon works. It's all fair game. Teams of 4 or less

events.title: Conversations with the Divine
events.description: Character interactions with divine figures are viewed in context of real-world religious and mythological stories

events.title: Character Spotlight: Dalinar
events.description: Thrilling discussion of Dalinar's journey and possible destination.

events.title: Sanderson YA
events.description: Evil Epics! Evil Librarians! Evil bits of chalk!

events.title: TWoTCast
events.description: High above the city of L.A. a team of terrorists has seized a building, taken hostages, and declared war. tWoTcast has managed to escape... An off-beat Wheel of Time reread podcast hiding somewhere inside. They're alone, tired... and the only chance anyone has got.

events.title: Speculation After Dark
events.description: Good day, bad day, doesn't matter: come predict the future of the Cosmere.

events.title: Whose Cosmere Is It Anyway?
events.description: Where the rules are made up and absolutely nothing matters. Our panelists endure randomly selected prompts for your entertainment.

events.title: Plato, Shinto, and the Cognitive Realm
events.description: What philosophical and religious concepts influenced Brandon's design for Shadesmar, the Cognitive Realm?

events.title: Diversity in Brandon's Works
events.description: How characters and readers respond to gender-, racial-, social-, and neuro-diversity in Sanderson's works.

events.title: Book Spotlight: Oathbringer
events.description: We've waited years to discuss this book. Now's the time.

events.title: Orientation to the Cosmere
events.description: Orientation to the Cosmere. Connect the dots of how Mistborn, Stormlight, Warbreaker, and other Cosmere books explicitly, implicitly, and extra-canonically connect.

events.title: Cosmere Magic 101
events.description: Learn why and how all these different Cosmere magic systems are manifestations of the same system with overarching rules and principles.

events.title: Sandertrack RAFOlympics
events.description: Open Q&A to grill Brandon. Try not to get RAFOed.

events.title: Behind the Scenes with Team Sanderson
events.description: Come learn how all these people enable Brandon's book-writing habit.

events.title: TWoTCast
events.description: Jono, Joe and Tom record LIVE! Drinking, interviews and games with prizes. Special guests from Team Jordan, games, interviews & prizes!

events.title: Navigating Patreon
events.description: Tips for navigating the world of Patreon.

events.title: 101 Art Ideas in an Hour
events.description: Amanda Makepeace leads a group of attendees in generating 101 art ideas in an hour.

events.title: 101 Art Ideas Walk
events.description: Join other con-goers in a casual walk around the Ravinia gardens, where we look for ideas and inspiration from the natural beauty that surrounds us. This is a great wake-up session, as well as the perfect lead-in to the 11:30 AM Panel.

events.title: Stephanie Law Watercolor Demo
events.description: Come watch our Artist Guest of Honor demonstrate her skills and  learn some of the techniques she uses in her watercolor paintings.

events.title: The Bird Whisperers Live!!
events.description: Two of our resident Bird Whisperer' tackle the same bird motif in just an hour.

events.title: GoH Stephanie Law Retrospective
events.description: Our Artist Guest of Honor shares her fabulous watercolor artwork and discusses how her work has evolved.

events.title: Win, Lose, or Draw
events.description: Start your morning with our hilarious take on a well-known game. Two teams, 4 artists, 2 sketchpads, and some sharpies. What could possibly go wrong?

events.title: How to Prepare for a Con for Artists and Vendors
events.description: JordanCon Veterans share tips and tricks for preparing for a convention.

events.title: Women in Illustration
events.description: An interactive discussion as we look at the art and experiences of women in the field of  fantasy and sci-fi illustration.

events.title: There Will Be Faeries
events.description: A look at the different depictions of the faeries throughout fantasy art, including classical fairy tale illustrators (such as Arthur Rackham & Edmund Dulac), Alan Lee & Brian Froud, and more modern, darker depictions of your favorite fae.

events.title: Artist Check-in
events.description:
Art Show Closed to Public. No panel due to Opening Ceremonies.

‏يتضمن هذا الحدث مكالمة فيديو لجلسة Hangout من Google.
الانضمام إلى: https://hangouts.google.com/hangouts/_/jordancon.org/artist-check-in?hceid=am9yZGFuY29uLm9yZ19kOHNrZGt1bTdhMDJnYmt2dHBhb2huNTU5a0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t.49bdr245313d6agv3o9bbkrfkp&hs=121

events.title: 2018 SF Trends
events.description: What is Trending in SF literature in 2018?

events.title: Afrofuturism
events.description: A discussion on Afrofuturism and related topics including similar litery movements and authors who are writing in this genre

events.title: Star Trek Discovery: Season 1
events.description: Did you like Discovery? Let's talk about the implications of the series in its first season.

events.title: Star Wars Rebels Season 4 Recap
events.description: Let's Talk about the final season of rebels, both the feels and the futures.

events.title: Blake's 7 & Beyond
events.description: A discussion of the British SF Television

events.title: Royal Manticore: Who Are They?
events.description: Come learn about the Royal Manticore Navy, their inspirations, and the works they love. Don't blame us if you get recruited!

events.title: Sorting Hat: Dr. Who Edition
events.description: So you like Dr. Who? You like Harry Potter? You like sorting people into Houses? Well then come dressed as your favorite Doctor and prepare to discuss which Doctor would work in which house. We will be discussing all the Doctors!

events.title: Dr. Who: The 13th Doctor & Beyond
events.description: A discussion on the new Doctor and her series as well as a general look at the series and where it is headed. Come dressed as your favorite Doctor!

events.title: Coffee in Cornwall: British SF Through Ages
events.description: A broad discussion about British SF, focusing on literary movements and the emergence of the distinctive voice of SF from the Isles.

events.title: Friday Fandom Smackdown
events.description: Space Battleship! This year a titanic space struggle between the Honorverse and the Vorkosigan Saga! Come Play Space Battleship and watch your enemy bleed atmo!

events.title: Bright: Why are there Orcs in my Cop Procedural?
events.description: Let's talk about Bright and thebroad spectrum of Science Fantasy. How close is it to Shadowrun, the RPG?

events.title: Silk Punk: What is it and why should you read it?
events.description: An examination of Silkpunk and the authors who are writing it.

events.title: What Is New in Science: 2017-2018 Edition
events.description: All the current exciting science trends from the last year.

events.title: Open Gaming
events.description: Bring your favorite games to share or hop into other games.

events.title: Magic: The Gathering Draft
events.description: Event will be held in the Gaming Room; price $15

events.title: The Punderdome
events.description: Punning game, needs description

events.title: Open Gaming and Demos
events.description: Bring your favorite games to share or hop into other games.

events.title: Open Gaming and Demos
events.description: Bring your favorite games to share or hop into other games. DarkfriendWerewolf Variant starts at 2:30pmE&D Games

events.title: Seanchan Hold'em
events.description: Annual Poker tournament with proceeds going towards the Mayo Clinic.  Please arrive in Perimeter Pavilion around 8:30 to sign up / get seated.  We'll begin promptly at 9 PM.

events.title: Homecoming Mums: Open craft time
events.description: Open workshop time for people to work on their homecoming mums in a come and go fashion. Supplies will be provide for various fees. Fees based on how much you bling out your mum. People are allowed to bring their own bling and ribbons too to add to the materials at hand.

events.title: Making Con-safe weapons
events.description: Warbla demonstration and other techniques to making props.  Optional $5.00 costs, if student wants to take warbla sample home.

events.title: Pewter Casting
events.description: Learn to carve soapstone to create molds for pouring pewter casts. Actual metal pouring will take place outside. Limit 20

events.title: Bracelet Weaving
events.description: Learn to make a fiber bracelet using a small loom.  Limit of 15. Supply fee of $15.00.

events.title: Lace Making
events.description: Learn the basics of bobbin lace making.  Class limit 10.

events.title: Drawing Workshop - Kaladin Stormblessed
events.description: In this workshop, artist Nat Rodgers teaches her method for designing and sketching her unofficial (but much loved) version of Kaladin, from author Brandon Sanderson's The Stormlight Archive. This workshop focuses on an easy, comic-book style portrait that anyone can do with practice, but also includes a number of tips for drawing and cartooning various character types at any level of experience. Along with drawing the character, participants will walk through the thought process of designing facial structure to match personality archetypes, and receive all take-home materials necessary to practice after the class. Class limit: 15. Class Fee: $15.00, which includes a Strathmore notepad and various pencils.

events.title: Running a Fan Store
events.description: Tips, advice, examples of how best to run an online store of your goods.

events.title: Creating Stormlight Glyphs
events.description: Learn how to write Stormlight glyphs, from their creator. A very different style of calligraphy.   Bring your own prefered pen style, or some calligraphy pens will be available for $3.00.  Graph paper will be provided.  Class limit 25.

events.title: SCA class - Brewing
events.description: An overview of old English brewing in early to late period England. An over view of period yeast, hop use, herbs and period laws governing brewing.

events.title: Dancing - West Coast Swing
events.description: Want to spin each other around the dance floor? No partner needed, come learn the basics of West Coast Swing in preparation for homecoming

events.title: SCA class - Leather tooling
events.description: Beginners leather workshop; make and take tooled key fob. Learn some basic leather construction, and several  basic tooling techniques for designs on pre-cut leather fobs.  Children need to be an adult to attend and be able to safely swing a hammer.   Class Limit: 15, Fee $10.00

events.title: Homecoming Mums: What in the World?
events.description: Build a homecoming mum of your very own. Get help and advice from crafters who can explain this southern American tradition. Supplies provided for various fees, going to the Charity. Fees based on how much you bling out your mum. People are allowed to bring their own bling and ribbons to add to the materials at hand.

events.title: The Murky Bog: Fanfiction & Copyright
events.description: Hey fans! Who doesn't love fanfiction and fanart? They are wonderful ways to immerse yourselves into your favorite worlds. Well, it turns out your favorite content creators might not. There has been much debate on where these works stand in the copyright sphere and the question grows ever more prominent as the Internet becomes even more integral to our fandoms.  All are welcome to join intellectual property attorney Ravi Persaud and Dragonsteel's Isaac Stewart as they try to help you work through the murky world of fan works!*No legal advice will be given at this panel, so please do not come expecting any.*

events.title: Patterns:  Adjusting them to fit You
events.description: Ever bought a pattern, spent hours sewing it up, and it still doesn't fit like you want? In this class we will demonstrate common alteration to make your patterns fit. Which will have your friends going from "aww, you made that?" to "YOU made That?!" Students will make the alteration on half-scale paper patterns to take home for reference.

events.title: What SHOULD we be reading?
events.description: Come listen to some book suggestions from our Staff and Guests.

events.title: Remaking the classics
events.description: A discussion with authors about bringing classic characters back to life for a new audience.

events.title: Looney Theories about the Kingkiller Chronicles
events.description: We discuss what plot points are still open and close them ourselves, and then combine it into Book 3 of KingKiller.

events.title: Where is it on the shelf?
events.description: There is a lot of gray area between YA and Middle Grades, Urban Fantasy and Paranormal Romance!

events.title: Rise & Fall of Neville Longbottom
events.description: Join our panel of HP experts as we explore why Voldemort chose Harry instead of Neville, and reveal the moment that set Neville free to fulfill his part of the prophecy.

events.title: Star Wars Redeux
events.description: What did we learn? What do we still want to know? Looney theories!

events.title: Dresden Hour
events.description: Advanced Dresden 102, including discussions of the later books and theories about what is coming with the new one!

events.title: Urban Fantasy Hour
events.description: A Discussion about the genre, itself, and a trek through the magic systems, characters, and settings in this powerhouse subgenre.

events.title: Myths and Monsters
events.description: The Bump in the Night is just the beginning! How mixing magic, mythology, monsters, and scenery create more than just a Friday night fright!

events.title: Some Scenes from Some of Shakespeare’s Best-known Plays
events.description: 5 actors perform scenes from Macbeth, Midsummer Night’s Dream, Hamlet, and Taming of The Shrew.

events.title: Intro to the Dresden Files
events.description: Who is Harry Dresden? Why have we cared for 13 books? Come and learn introductory and spoiler free knowledge of the series!

events.title: Great Fight Scenes
events.description: What is it about fight scenes in books that make them amazing? We'll be talking mechanics, ignorance, and editorial special effects!

events.title: Are you a BRIGHT?
events.description: We'll discuss the Netflix Original show Bright in as vivid detail as we can in 60 minutes.

events.title: Unanswered Questions
events.description: WoT is done and we still have questions and theories! (Of course we do.)

events.title: Fantasy Casting
events.description: WoT is coming to TV. This is the fantasy casting panel you've been waiting for!

events.title: Inspired Ladies of WoT
events.description: A look at Jordan’s inspirations for the main female supporters of the Light—myth fortheir awesome powers and history for their humanity.

events.title: Robert Jordan's Notes
events.description: Discussion and presentation of RJ's notes from the Addlestone Library.

events.title: WoT Spelling Bee
events.description: Can you spell "Rhuidean" correctly at 10pm? Join us at the bar and try your luck!

events.title: Daes Dae'mar
events.description: Team Trivia competition! Bring your friends or join another team and do battle with your wits!

events.title: Team Jordan LIVE
events.description: Team Jordan discusses Robert Jordan himself.

events.title: Teaching Robert Jordan
events.description: Discussing the importance of narrative storytelling, myth, & fantasy to the greater world, and as a gateway to student learning.

events.title: Ravens (YA)
events.description: Remember that one time when they tried to market The Eye of the World to kids? No? (We remember!)

events.title: Sorting Hat: Seanchan Edition
events.description: Would Suroth be Slytherin or a Gryffindor? Where would the Sorting Hat have placed Tuon? Come dish with us on these topic while the audience votes and place the Seanchan into their Houses!

events.title: Braid Tugging: Hair Styling
events.description: From braids, to curling wands, and more, come learn different ways to style your hair for the homecoming dance from a professional hair stylist.

events.title: Illian Trivia Bee
events.description: Individual trivia competition! Come show us how much you know about the World of the Wheel!

events.title: Wheel of Time for Beginners
events.description: New to the Wheel? Tagging along with a friend or significant other? Come join us for an orientation!

events.title: Intro to Bellydance
events.description: Learn a sexy, fun, and exciting form of dance - no partner required! Participants are encouraged to bring their own hip scarves or Ajah shawls, some loaners are available. This class is open to all participants ages 16 and up.

events.title: A Reading with Brandon Sanderson
events.description:
‏يتضمن هذا الحدث مكالمة فيديو لجلسة Hangout من Google.
الانضمام إلى: https://hangouts.google.com/hangouts/_/jordancon.org/a-reading-with?hceid=am9yZGFuY29uLm9yZ19jNTkybWg1Y2VsdDA2bGlxcGhycDdndmlkMEBncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t.053eif86n8r4782lh7nangssfi&hs=121

events.title: Keeping the Fandom Alive
events.description: Now that the books are over where do we go from here? How do we maintain the community we've built?

events.title: Signing with Jason Denzel
events.description:
‏يتضمن هذا الحدث مكالمة فيديو لجلسة Hangout من Google.
الانضمام إلى: https://hangouts.google.com/hangouts/_/jordancon.org/signing-with?hceid=am9yZGFuY29uLm9yZ19jNTkybWg1Y2VsdDA2bGlxcGhycDdndmlkMEBncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t.04eeh596oc44239ior9mmii90v&hs=121

events.title: One Night in Falme
events.description: The Return. Homecoming. Another excuse for Paul to play more 80's music.

events.title: Costume Contest and Jordan Con Awards Ceremony
events.description: Come watch our costumers present their master works as we present the 3rd annual Jordan Con Awards.

events.title: Prejudging Costume Contest
events.description: Entries for the Costume contest will have their chance to display their costumes for the judges before being presented to the crowd. Costume Contest Entrants only.

events.title: Baen Travelling Road Show (with prizes!)
events.description: A preview of upcoming works from Baen Books.

events.title: SCA Fighting Demo
events.description: Watch as the Society for Creative Anachronism demonstrates various fighting techniques.

events.title: Stories Through Sound
events.description: Learn how to tell your whole story through sound! From the inflection of the actors to creating the sound effects that bring your story to life, the Atlanta Radio Theatre Company can help you improve your story and your show

events.title: Dancing - West Coast Swing
events.description: Want to spin each other around the dance floor? No partner needed, come learn the basics of West Coast Swing in preparation for homecoming

events.title: 10 years of Jordan Con
events.description: Has it been 10 years already?  Join our Con Chairs as they discuss how Jordan wen from being a bad idea to the family we all love today.

events.title: Blue Cole Book Release
events.description: Join Blue Cole,  Georgia Author of the Year nominee, as he releases his fourth novel, Elsewhere. In addition to a reading, Q&A session, he'll talk about the development of the novel, his inspiration, and entertain attendees with his unique humor and style.

events.title: Theoryland and Dragonmount 20th Anniversary
events.description: 2018 marks the 20th anniversary of the two of the biggest Wheel of Time fan sites.  Join us for a conversation about how it all went down.

events.title: Karaoke
events.description: Your chance to show of your singing skills or lack there of at our annual Karaoke night.

events.title: Dancing - Ballroom
events.description: Learn a few Ballroom styles of dance to impress everyone at the homecoming dance on Saturday.

events.title: Speed Friending
events.description: New to the con? Are you shy? Just want to meet new people? Join us for Speed Friending!

events.title: Blademaster Tournament
events.description: There are two ways to become a blademaster.  Vie with other attendees for the chance to fight against a blademaster to become a blademaster.

events.title: Writing Sequels and Series
events.description: The first book is always the toughest? Maybe not. What challenges and special considerations does writing a sequel or series entail?

events.title: Come practice for the Blademaster tournament
events.description: Come practice for the Blademaster tournament.

events.title: Once Upon a Time at JordanCon...
events.description: Come watch as a group of hilarious authors play Asmodee's story telling game, Once Upon a Time, on our main stage! Laugh, cry, and laugh some more, I'm sure fun is in store!

events.title: Opening Ceremonies
events.description: Welcome to our tenth annual JordanCon's Opening Ceremonies Extravaganza!

events.title: Writers Round Table
events.description: Open Forum discussion for Writers Track attendees

events.title: 3..2..1.. FLASH FIC!
events.description: We'll provide the prompts, you provide the Flash Fic! Bring a means to write! A few pros will be writing and sharing too!

events.title: Learn from my Mistakes
events.description: Publishing pros talk about the hard lessons they learned in the hopes that you might not make the same mistake.

events.title: Violence for Writers
events.description: Writing a great action scene, do's and don't's

events.title: Being Gratuitous
events.description: Mature Content. From swearing to sex to Trigger Warning content. How to write it well, and why to even use it.

events.title: Open Writing
events.description: Want to just get away somewhere a bit quiet and write that isn't your hotel room? The room will be open to sit and write and maybe have some quiet conversation.

events.title: JordanCon's Got Slush!
events.description: Live read and critique of pre-submitted writing, as though submitted to a slush pile at a publisher.

events.title: Openings and Their Importance
events.description:
A panel discussion about the things every opening must do, beyond a great opening line.
Character, setting, conflict are just the beginning!

events.title: GoH Jason Denzel Reading/Discussion
events.description: Jason reads a bit of his upcoming writing, then answers whatever embarrassing questions Aubree (or you!) can think up.

events.title: [YA] The Hidden World of Magic
events.description: A look at worldbuilding involved in having secret magical cultures, with a focus on YA.

events.title: Turning your Passion into a Job
events.description: Routines, work-life, the humdrum... all the stuff writers do when they aren't writing and how much it really eats away at the writing process, and how to not let it get you down.

events.title: Writers Workshop - Extended
events.description: JordanCon's annual free-to-attend Writers' Workshop. Due to limited space, sign up in advance is required (via website or Registration Desk).

events.title: Writers Workshop
events.description: JordanCon's annual free-to-attend Writers' Workshop. Due to limited space, sign up in advance is required (via website or Registration Desk).

events.title: Pitch Critique
events.description: Annual Pitch Critique. Come try out your elevator pitch in a no-stress session and get feedback.

events.title: Writing Sequels and Series
events.description: See Main Programming

events.title: Writing in a Sub-Culture
events.description: Be it seafaring, military, or nihlist punk-rock bands, it can be difficult writing in a sub-culture. Come get tips.
